CatDescriptText: Mr. Alvin Grant, 7416 Susquehanna Street, and Mr. Nate Smith, 6950 Fifth Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 1, 1958, pg. 9 with question: "Do you believe in corporal (paddling) punishment for students, in the elementary grades, who misbehave? If so, who should mete [sic]  out the punishment-- the teacher or the principal?" Mr. Alvin Grant�s answer reads: �No, they shouldn�t be whipped.  There should be other penalties used, like sitting in the corner, wearing a dunce hat and other things like the old methods.�  Mr. Nate Smith�s answer reads: �I think that this should be discussed more frequently at Parent Teacher Association meetings.  Some parents believe in shipping while others do not.  I think that it should be down away with until there is an agreement as to what to do.�
TitMainTitle: Alvin Grant and Nate Smith wearing tweed coat and beret, standing in front of automobiles, with Downtown in background
